subject: Naming Test classes, was:Re: [junit] Test Variants
msgSnippet: ... Building test classes around the fixture is a good idea. However, I m not very comfortable with the names we have chosen for these classes so far, since it
messageBody:
> Strong suggestion: place these tests in their own Test Case class and
> make the shared data instance variables. It will clean things up a lot
> and shorten the test names.

Building test classes around the fixture is a good idea. However, I'm not
very comfortable with the names we have chosen for these classes so far,
since it is often difficult to find a descriptive way for the fixture
itself. It's easier when the fixture somehow refers to a common
functionality, eg. AccountTransferTest having two Account instances in its
fixture; but even here the exceptional case of transfering money from one
account to itself only uses one of the two instances.

Any experiences/hints/suggestions with choosing names for fixture based test
classes?

Johannes
